name: Carbon Fiber PLA (CFPLA)
notes: Matte finish, low shrinkage, sharp detail.

name: Tough PLA
notes: PLA blended for higher impact resistance and toughness.

specs.chemical_safety: Very Low (safe handling, no special precautions)

name: High-Speed PLA
notes: Lower viscosity to enable very fast print speeds.

specs.chemical_safety: Very Low (safe handling, no special precautions)

name: TPU 99D
notes: Very rigid thermoplastic polyurethane with high hardness and durability; minimal flexibility.

name: PCTG
notes: PETG variant with improved flexibility and printability; less prone to warping and moisture uptake than PETG.

name: Glass-Filled Nylon (GF Nylon)
notes: Nylon reinforced with glass fibers for enhanced strength and heat resistance; excellent for structural components.

name: PVA (Polyvinyl Alcohol)
notes: Water-soluble support material; biodegradable and oil-resistant.

specs.chemical_safety: Very Low (safe handling, no special precautions)

name: PLA
notes: Easy, versatile; limited heat and UV resistance.

specs.chemical_safety: Very Low (safe handling, no special precautions)

name: PETG
notes: Tougher than PLA; more heat tolerant; can warp and is moisture sensitive.

name: Carbon Fiber PETG (CF PETG)
notes: Stiffer with reduced warping vs standard PETG.

name: ASA
notes: UV/heat resistant, matte; lower warping than ABS.

name: PC PBT (Polycarbonate/PBT blend)
notes: More printable PC blend; good cold/chemical resistance.
use_cases: Functional parts used in cooler environments

name: Polycarbonate (PC)
notes: Very strong; prone to warp; favors an enclosure.

name: PEKK
notes: High-performance polymer; easier than PEEK.

name: SEBS
notes: Rubberlike flexible; extruder-dependent tuning.

name: PSU (Polysulfone)
notes: High-heat and chemical resistance; sterilizable.

name: Carbon Fiber PET (CF PET)
notes: PET reinforced with carbon fibers for enhanced strength and stiffness; stiffer than standard PETG.

name: Ultem (PEI)
notes: High-performance polyetherimide with exceptional heat resistance and strength; used in aerospace and medical applications.

name: PC-ABS
notes: Blend of polycarbonate and ABS combining PC's strength with ABS's printability and impact resistance.
use_cases: Functional parts requiring impact resistance and heat deflection

name: nGen (Co-polyester)
notes: Co-polyester filament similar to PETG but with improved heat resistance and transparency.
use_cases: Functional parts and prototypes requiring transparency

name: Silk PLA
notes: Shiny aesthetic; weaker mechanics; can clog.

specs.chemical_safety: Very Low (safe handling, no special precautions)

name: Wood PLA
notes: Wood-loaded for appearance; weaker; moisture-prone.

specs.chemical_safety: Very Low (safe handling, no special precautions)

name: Carbon Fiber PC (CF PC)
notes: Extremely stiff; challenging; favors an enclosure and high temps.

specs.ease_of_printing: Very Low (requires high temps, hardened nozzle, enclosure)

name: HIPS
notes: Support material; dissolves in limonene.

name: PET (Bottle-grade)
notes: Stiffer than PETG; harder to print; wants enclosure.

name: PA6 Nylon
notes: Strong/flexible but very hygroscopic; warps without chamber.

name: Glass-Filled PP (GF PP)
notes: Tough and weather-resistant; adhesion/warping are tricky.

name: Matte PLA
notes: PLA formulated to produce a matte finish, reducing layer visibility for aesthetic prints.

specs.chemical_safety: Very Low (safe handling, no special precautions)

name: Glow-in-the-Dark PLA
notes: PLA infused with phosphorescent materials that glow after exposure to light.
use_cases: Novelty items, safety markers, artistic prints

specs.chemical_safety: Very Low (safe handling, no special precautions)

name: Magnetic PLA
notes: PLA infused with iron particles, making prints magnetic.
use_cases: Educational models, magnetic tools, interactive projects

specs.chemical_safety: Very Low (safe handling, no special precautions)

name: Color-Changing PLA
notes: PLA with thermochromic or photochromic properties that change color with temperature or light exposure.
use_cases: Novelty items, temperature indicators, interactive designs

specs.chemical_safety: Very Low (safe handling, no special precautions)

name: Conductive PLA
notes: PLA infused with conductive materials like graphene, allowing for low-voltage electrical conductivity.
use_cases: Low-voltage electronic circuits, sensors, interactive prototypes

specs.chemical_safety: Very Low (safe handling, no special precautions)

name: Flex PLA (PCL)
notes: Flexible PLA variant offering slight elasticity; easier to print than TPU but less flexible.

specs.chemical_safety: Very Low (safe handling, no special precautions)

name: PVB
notes: Transparent filament that can be smoothed with alcohol; good for aesthetic prints.

name: Nylon PA-12
notes: Lower moisture absorption than PA-6; better dimensional stability and easier to print.
use_cases: Durable parts with better dimensional stability

name: Carbon Fiber Nylon PA-6 (CF Nylon PA-6)
notes: Nylon PA-6 reinforced with carbon fibers for enhanced strength and stiffness.

name: TPU 80D
notes: Rigid thermoplastic polyurethane offering balance between flexibility and hardness.

name: TPU (Low Durometer)
notes: Very soft TPU; tends to snake/jam; not breathable for wearables.

specs.ease_of_printing: Low (tends to snake/jam, requires careful settings)

name: Polypropylene (PP)
notes: Light and durable but notorious for warp/adhesion issues.
use_cases: Containers/hinges if you can tame it

name: OBC (Olefin Block Copolymer)
notes: Aims for PP toughness + PETG versatility; still adhesion/warp problems.

name: PEEK
notes: Exceptional properties but extremely demanding and costly; needs enclosure.

specs.ease_of_printing: Very Low (requires specialized equipment, high temps)

name: PPS
notes: Excellent chemical resistance; difficult and expensive.

specs.ease_of_printing: Very Low (requires specialized equipment, high temps)

name: Glass-Filled Nylon (GFPA)
notes: Very durable; requires abrasion-resistant nozzles and temp control. More challenging than S-tier GF Nylon.

name: PMMA (Acrylic)
notes: Clear and pretty but brittle; poor adhesion.

name: ABS
notes: Durable and impact-resistant but prone to warping and emitting fumes during printing.

name: Carbon Fiber Nylon PA-12 (CF Nylon PA-12)
notes: Nylon PA-12 reinforced with carbon fibers; more challenging than PA-6 variants.
use_cases: High-strength parts with better dimensional stability

name: Nylon/PETG Alloys
notes: Blend aiming to combine nylon toughness with PETG printability; still challenging to print.
use_cases: Tough parts if printing challenges are overcome

name: Clear PMMA
notes: Transparent acrylic filament used for light diffusers and displays; brittle and poor adhesion.

name: Chocolate
notes: Edible material for novelty prints; not practical for standard 3D printing applications.

name: Wax Filament (MOLDLAY)
notes: Wax-based filament for lost wax casting; melts away during metal casting process.
use_cases: Jewelry casting, dental applications, metal casting patterns

name: Sandstone Filament
notes: PLA infused with stone particles to create a sandstone-like finish and texture.
use_cases: Architectural models, decorative items, artistic pieces

specs.chemical_safety: Very Low (safe handling, no special precautions)

name: Cleaning Filament
notes: Specialized filament used to clean and unclog nozzles; not for printing objects.

name: TPU 80C
notes: Softer thermoplastic polyurethane providing greater flexibility than 80D variant.

specs.ease_of_printing: Very Low (requires specialized equipment, high temps)

name: PES
notes: High-temperature resistance and mechanical strength; challenging to print.

specs.ease_of_printing: Very Low (requires specialized equipment, high temps)

name: PPSU
notes: Excellent thermal and chemical resistance; used in medical and aerospace applications.

specs.ease_of_printing: Very Low (requires specialized equipment, high temps)

name: Carbon Fiber PEEK (CF PEEK)
notes: PEEK reinforced with carbon fibers; extremely demanding but offers exceptional properties.

specs.ease_of_printing: Very Low (requires specialized equipment, high temps)

name: Metal-Filled Composites
notes: Costly and brittle vs PLA; aesthetic-first materials.

name: HDPE
notes: Extreme warping; very poor adhesion.

specs.ease_of_printing: Very Low (extreme shrinkage, very poor adhesion)

name: POM (Acetal/Delrin)
notes: Nearly zero bed adhesion; overheating risks toxic fumes.

specs.ease_of_printing: Very Low (very poor adhesion, high shrinkage)

name: 5x Metal-Filled PLA
notes: PLA infused with metal powders (bronze, copper, steel, etc.); very abrasive and brittle.

name: Non-clear PMMA
notes: Opaque versions of acrylic; brittle and poor adhesion like clear PMMA.

name: TPE
notes: Highly flexible thermoplastic elastomer; very challenging to print due to extreme elasticity.

name: PVDF
notes: Tough/chemical-resistant but hazardous decomposition risk if overheated.
use_cases: Niche chemical-resistance needs with capable machines

specs.ease_of_printing: Very Low (requires specialized equipment, high temps)

name: TPI (Kapton)
notes: Requires extreme temps; impractical on hobby machines.

name: PORO-LAY
notes: Partially water-soluble filament that creates porous structures; specialized material for unique applications.

specs.chemical_safety: Very Low (safe handling, no special precautions)
